doc.field: Regional Parcel Dataset - Year-End 2003, Seven County Twin Cities Metropolitan Area
Regional Parcel Dataset - Year-End 2003, Seven County Twin Cities Metropolitan Area
The Metropolitan Council and the Counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington
The Metropolitan Council and the Counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington
Counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington
Counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington

This dataset is a compilation of tax parcel polygon layers from the seven Twin Cities, Minnesota metropolitan area counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington. The seven counties were assembled into a common coordinate system. No attempt has been made to edgematch or rubbersheet between counties. A standard set of attribute fields is included for each county. Not all attributes are populated for all counties.
This is an annual version of the MetroGIS Regional Parcel Dataset that can be used with other annual versions to do change analysis and time series investigations. This dataset is intended to contain all updates to each county's parcel data through the end of 2003. It was originally published as the 'January 1, 2004' version of the dataset. See the Currentness Reference below and the Entity and Attribute information in Section 5 for more information about the dates for specific aspects of the dataset.
This dataset contains one record for each real estate/tax parcel polygon. In many places a one-to-one relationship does not exist between these parcel polygons and the actual buildings or occupancy units that lie within them. There may be many buildings on one parcel and there may be many occupancy units (e.g. apartments, stores or offices) within each building. Additionally, no information exists within this dataset about residents of parcels. Parcel owner and taxpayer information exists for many, but not all counties.
Some counties have also made available a parcel points dataset that includes the same attribute fields as the polygon dataset. The point are intended to provide information in situations where multiple tax parcels are represented by a single polygon. The primary example of this is the condominium. Condominiums, by definition, are legally owned as individual, taxed real estate units. Records for condominiums may not show up in the polygon dataset.
This is a MetroGIS Regionally Endorsed dataset. (See http://www.metrogis.org/data/about/index.shtml#whatis for more information.)
Each of the seven Metro Area counties has entered into a multiparty agreement with the Metropolitan Council to assemble and distribute the parcel data for each county as a regional (seven county) parcel dataset.

A standard set of attribute fields is included for each county. Not all attributes are populated for all counties.

See the Currentness Reference below and the Entity and Attribute information in Section 5 for more information about the dates for specific aspects of the dataset.

In many places a one-to-one relationship does not exist between these parcel polygons and the actual buildings or occupancy units that lie within them. There may be many buildings on one parcel and there may be many occupancy units (e.g. apartments, stores or offices) within each building. Additionally, no information exists within this dataset about residents of parcels. Parcel owner and taxpayer information exists for many, but not all counties.

Condominiums, by definition, are legally owned as individual, taxed real estate units. Records for condominiums may not show up in the polygon dataset.
This is a MetroGIS Regionally Endorsed dataset. (See http://www.metrogis.org/data/about/index.shtml#whatis for more information.)
Each of the seven Metro Area counties has entered into a multiparty agreement with the Metropolitan Council to assemble and distribute the parcel data for each county as a regional (seven county) parcel dataset.</abstract><purpose>To view, analyze and display parcel data anywhere in the seven county metro area. This is an annual version of the MetroGIS Regional Parcel Dataset that can be used with other annual versions to do change analysis and time series investigations.</purpose><supplinf>Twin Cities 7 County Metropolitan Area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington in Minnesota.</supplinf></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><sngdate><caldate>20031231</caldate></sngdate></timeinfo><current>This dataset reflects the status of each county's parcel polygon and attribute data as of the following dates:
Anoka = 12/16/2003 for polygons and 12/16/2003 for attributes Carver = 01/21/2004 for polygons and 01/21/2004 for attributes Dakota = 12/31/2003 for polygons and 12/31/2003 for attributes Hennepin = 01/12/2004 for polygons and 01/05/2004 for attributes Ramsey = 01/05/2004 for polygons, attribute dates vary Scott = 01/08/2004 for polygons and 01/10/2004 for attributes Washington = 12/26/2003 for polygons and 12/26/2003 for attributes</current></timeperd><status><progress>Complete</progress><update>Annually</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc>-94.012</westbc><eastbc>-92.732</eastbc><northbc>45.415</northbc><southbc>44.471</southbc></bounding></spdom><keywords><theme><themekt>None</themekt><themekey>parcels, regional parcel data, cadastre, land ownership</themekey></theme><place><placekey>Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County</placekey></place></keywords><accconst>None</accconst><useconst>None</useconst><browse><browsen>http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/bg/metrogis_regional_parcels.jpg</browsen><browsed>Sample map showing the MetroGIS Regional Parcel Data.</browsed></browse><native>See metadata for individual counties.</native><crossref><citeinfo><title>Various parcel datasets available at the MetroGIS DataFinder website at http://www.datafinder.org/catalog/index.asp#LandOwnership</title></citeinfo></crossref><ptcontac><cntinfo><cntperp><cntorg>MetroGIS</cntorg></cntperp><cntaddr><addrtype> mailing and physical address </addrtype></cntaddr><cntemail>metrogis-contacts@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail></cntinfo></ptcontac></idinfo><dataqual><attracc><attraccr>A standard set of attribute fields is included for each county. However, not all attributes are available for all counties. No attempt has been made by MetroGIS to assess the accuracy of the attribute data.
Any questions or comments about suspected errors or omissions in this dataset can be addressed to the contact person listed in the individual county metadata. Links to that metadata can be found in the Horizontal Positional Accuracy element below.</attraccr></attracc><logic>No attempt was made to edgematch or rubbersheet the seven counties, thus overlaps and gaps will exist between counties. Not all tax parcels are represented by a unique polygon. For example, a county might have one polygon representing a condominium complex. Some counties have provided an additional parcel points shape file that will include points to represent such tax parcels (e.g. a point for each individual condominium).</logic><complete>For parcel attributes, see Section 5 of this metadata. For parcel geography, see metadata for individual counties.
Any questions or comments about suspected errors or omissions in this dataset can be addressed to the contact person listed in the individual county metadata. Links to that metadata can be found in the Horizontal Positional Accuracy element below.</complete><posacc><horizpa><horizpar>ANOKA: No information provided.
CARVER: The Horizontal Accuracy of the counties parcel dataset is, for the most part, UNDER 1' accuracy. This is possible because the County's Surveyor used COGO (Coordinate Geometry) which is a highly accurate way of plotting parcel lines.
DAKOTA: 90% less than 2.0 feet
HENNEPIN: Estimated to be +or- 2 to 4 feet at section corners. Positional accuracy decreases with distance from section corners.
RAMSEY: Digitized information is generally +or- 7 feet; some areas have been found to be +or- 30 feet. Cogo (coordinate geometry) accuracy generally is +or- 1.0 foot.
SCOTT: No information provided.
WASHINGTON: Digitized features outside areas of high vertical relief (e.g. major river valleys) tested 23 feet horizontal accuracy at the 95 % confidence level using National Standard Spatial Data Accuracy (NSSDA).
Digitized features within areas of high vertical relief tested 120 feet horizontal accuracy by other testing procedures.
All other features are generated by coordinate geometry and based on a framework of accurately located PLSS corner positions used with public information of record. Computed positions of parcel boundaries are not based on individual field surveys. Although tests of randomly selected points may show high accuracy between field and parcel map content, variations between boundary monumentation and legal description of record can and do exist. Caution is necessary in use of land boundary data shown. Contact the Land Management/Land Survey Division for more information.</horizpar></horizpa></posacc><lineage><srcinfo><srcscale /></srcinfo><procstep><procdesc>Each county provided parcel polygons and attributes in shape file format with UTM coordinates, to the Metropolitan Council. The Metropolitan Council checked each shape file to insure it had all desired attribute fields, field names, types and lengths.
No attempt was made to edgematch or rubber sheet the parcel geography between counties.</procdesc></procstep></lineage></dataqual><spdoinfo><indspref>None</indspref><direct>Vector</direct><mgmg3obj>polygon shapes</mgmg3obj><mgmg3til>One shape file for each of the seven counties.</mgmg3til></spdoinfo><eainfo><overview><eaover>A standard set of attribute fields is included for each county; however, not all attributes fields are populated by each county. Some qualifying comments have been provided by counties and are included after the description of the attributes.
COUNTY_ID: Three digit FIPS and state standard county code. 003 = Anoka 019 = Carver 037 = Dakota 053 = Hennepin 123 = Ramsey 139 = Scott 163 = Washington
PIN: Unique regional parcel ID comprised of the county PIN with the county code and dash appended to the front.
OWN_NAME: The full (first and last) name of the owner. The format (e.g. last name first or last name last) and inclusion of multiple owners is up to each county.
Anoka: No data. Dakota: Owner name or Contract Purchaser name. Not all owner names will appear on joint or multiple ownership parcels. Ramsey: Uses PRIMARY. This is not guaranteed to be the owner.
OWN_ADD_L1: Owner address line 1. OWN_ADD_L2: Owner address line 2. OWN_ADD_L3: Owner address line 3. These three fields are for the mailing address of the owner. Typically line 1 is street address and line 2 is city, state & zip, but other variations exist.
Hennepin: No data. Ramsey: Uses PRIMARY address. This is not guaranteed to be the owner's address.
TAX_NAME: The full (first and last) name of the taxpayer. The format (e.g. last name first or last name last) and inclusion of multiple taxpayers is up to each county.
Anoka: No data. Dakota: No data. Ramsey: Uses ALTERNATE name. When available, this is often the person who pays taxes. This field is usually blank. Washington: Some data provided.
TAX_ADD_L1: Taxpayer address line 1. TAX_ADD_L2: Taxpayer address line 2. TAX_ADD_L3: Taxpayer address line 3. Mailing address of the taxpayer. Typically line 1 is street address and line 2 is city, state & zip, but other variations exist.
Dakota: No data. Ramsey: Uses ALTERNATE address. The fields are usually blank. Washington: No data.
HOMESTEAD: Homesteaded (Y/N).
Anoka: Used EXPT_CODE1 = HST. Some additional homesteads may exist. Does not distinguish between agricultural and residential homesteads. Dakota: Payable 2004 Homestead Status. Y includes fractional and disabled homesteads. Hennepin: 2003 Assessment for Taxes Payable in 2004. Ramsey: Uses numeric codes. There are issues with converting partial and disabled homesteads to a direct Y/N.
BLDG_NUM: The building or house number of the parcel. Note that in some cases in Dakota and Hennepin Counties, leading and following blank spaces exist in this field which may cause problems when performing a search (e.g. search for "12345" may not find " 12345").
Dakota: Field is unverified.
STREET: The street name (with street type and direction). This is the actual location of the parcel, which may not be the mailing address.
Dakota: Field is unverified.
CITY: Name of city or township in which the parcel resides (not the mailing address city or township).
Note that for Carver, Ramsey, Scott and Washington Counties, this field is not populated according to the definition above
ZIP: Zip code in which the parcel resides
Dakota: Field is unverified.
EMV_LAND: Land estimated market value. EMV_BLDG: Building estimated market value. EMV_TOTAL: Total estimated market value. This may include more than the land and building values.
Anoka: 2003 estimated values for taxes payable in 2004. Carver: 2003 estimated values for taxes payable in 2004. Dakota: 2003 estimated values for taxes payable in 2004. Hennepin: 2003 estimated values for taxes payable in 2004. EMV_TOTAL includes sum of Land, Building & Machinery Estimated Market Values. Ramsey: 2002 estimated values for taxes payable in 2003. Scott: 2003 estimated values for taxes payable in 2004. Washington: 2003 estimated values for taxes payable in 2004.
TAX_CAPAC: Tax capacity of the parcel.
Anoka: For taxes payable in 2003. Carver: For taxes payable in 2003. Dakota: Total tax capacity, year payable 2003. Hennepin: For taxes payable in 2003. Ramsey: No data. Scott: No data. Washington: For taxes payable in 2003
TOTAL_TAX: Total tax of the parcel.
Anoka: For taxes payable in 2003. Carver: For taxes payable in 2003. Dakota: Total real estate tax, including special assessments, due and payable in 2003. Hennepin: For Taxes Payable in 2003 (includes special assessments). Ramsey: For taxes payable in 2003. Scott: No data. Washington: No data.
TAX_EXEMPT: Tax exempt (Y/N).
Anoka: Used EXPT_CODE1 = EXM. Hennepin: 2002 Assessment for Taxes Payable in 2003. Ramsey: Uses CAMA numeric codes for land use codes. Numeric codes in the six hundred range were assumed to be exempt and converted to Y. All others were coded N. Scott: No data.
YEAR_BUILT: The year the primary structure was initially built.
Hennepin: This field is populated by individual city assessors and cannot be guaranteed by Hennepin County. Ramsey: Dwelling data and Commercial data were combined. Washington: No values newer than 1999. No values for Woodbury.
SCHOOL_DST: Unique school district number.
WSHD_DIST: Watershed district name.
Hennepin: Data for approximately 63% of properties. Properties that do not have a watershed name are located in a watershed district that does not levy a watershed district tax rate. Ramsey: The last character of the district code was used with a lookup table to produce a descriptive watershed district. Scott: No data.
NUM_UNITS: Number of residential units.
Anoka: Some data provided. Carver: No data. Dakota: Data provided. Hennepin: No data. Ramsey: Data provided. Scott: No data. Washington: No data.
STRUC_TYPE: Information pertaining to the type of structure on the parcel.
Carver: No data. Dakota: Describes the main use for which this building was designed, such as single family residence, duplex, tri-plex, restaurant, etc. Hennepin: No data. Ramsey: Uses CAMA codes. Dwelling and commercial tables were aggregated and a lookup table was developed to produce structure descriptions.
SALE_DATE: Date of last sale. In general this includes all "arm's length" transactions and would not, for example, include a sale to a family member for $1. This may vary by county.
Carver: Includes all sales. Dakota: Month and year of last QUALIFIED SALE (day not part of attributes available). Day of the month is fictitious (set to the 1st of the month to conform to date field FORMAT). Ramsey: The CAMA valid sales were used. Data exist for 39% of parcels. Washington: No values newer than 8/14/2000 and no data for Woodbury.
SALE_VALUE: Value of last sale.
Anoka: Field is partially populated. Ramsey: The CAMA valid sales were used. Data exist for 39% of parcels.
PARC_CODE: Parcel Polygon to Parcel Point and PIN Relationship Code. This field is used to provide information about the relationship between parcel polygons, parcel points and unique tax parcel identifiers (PINs). At this time, most counties do not populate this field. Values are:
0 = Information not available or not provided 1 = Valid Parcel with a single tax PIN 2 = In polygon dataset: Parcel polygon representing multiple tax PINs In point dataset: One of multiple parcel points that together are represented by a single polygon
The values below are likely only to be found in the polygon dataset. The polygons for which they are assigned are unlikely to have a tax PIN or other parcel attributes. The parcel points datasets, where available, are unlikely to include these feature types.
10 = Condominium Common Area 11 = Right-of-way 12 = Easement 13 = Ownership Unknown 14 = Gap between parcel boundary descriptions 15 = Water Body 16 = Ditch 17 = Walkway 98 = Other non-parcel feature 99 = Unspecified non-parcel feature
Anoka: No data. Hennepin: No data. Scott: No data.</eaover></overview></eainfo><distinfo><resdesc>MetroGIS Regional Parcels 2003</resdesc><distliab>NOTICE: The Geographic Information System (GIS) Data to which this notice is attached are made available pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minnesota Statutes Chapter 13). - ArcView shape files - metadata for the dataset (.htm)</ordering></stdorder><distrib><cntinfo><cntperp><cntorg>Metropolitan Council, on behalf of MetroGIS</cntorg><cntper>Jon Hoekenga</cntper></cntperp><cntaddr><addrtype> mailing and physical address </addrtype><address>390 Robert Street North</address><city>St. Paul</city><state>Minnesota</state><postal>55101-1805</postal></cntaddr><cntvoice>651-602-1561</cntvoice><cntfax>651-602-1674</cntfax><cntemail>jonathan.hoekenga@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail></cntinfo></distrib></distinfo><metainfo><metd>20120719</metd><metstdn>Minnesota Geographic Metadata Guidelines</metstdn><metstdv>1.2</metstdv><metextns><onlink>http://www.gis.state.mn.us/stds/metadata.htm</onlink></metextns><metc><cntinfo><cntperp><cntorg>Metropolitan Council</cntorg><cntper>Mark Kotz</cntper></cntperp><cntpos>GIS Database Administrator</cntpos><cntaddr><addrtype> mailing and physical address </addrtype><address>390 Robert Street North</address><city>St. Paul</city><state>Minnesota</state><postal>55101-1805</postal></cntaddr><cntvoice>651-602-1644</cntvoice><cntfax>651-602-1674</cntfax><cntemail>mark.kotz@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail></cntinfo></metc></metainfo><Esri><ModDate>20120224</ModDate><ModTime>15420700</ModTime></Esri><mdDateSt Sync="TRUE">20120224</mdDateSt><spref><horizsys><planar><gridsys><gridsysn>Universal Transverse Mercator</gridsysn><utm><utmzone>15</utmzone></utm></gridsys><planci><plandu>meters</plandu></planci></planar><geodetic><horizdn>NAD83</horizdn><ellips>GRS80</ellips></geodetic></horizsys></spref></metadata>
